summary: This is an email chain from January 2020 between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing newly received flight records for Jeffrey Epstein's private jet. The key revelation is that the records show Donald Trump traveled on the jet many more times than previously known, including flights with Ghislaine Maxwell and potential witnesses.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Listed as a passenger on at least eight flights on Epstein's private jet between 1993 and 1996, including flights with Ghislaine Maxwell and his family members.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Potential defendant, passenger on Epstein's private jet
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of a potential case; was present as a passenger on at least four flights with Donald Trump according to the flight records.

persons.name: Marla Maples
persons.context: Listed as having traveled with Donald Trump on Epstein's private jet at various times.

persons.name: Tiffany Trump
persons.context: Donald Trump's daughter, listed as having traveled with him on Epstein's private jet.

persons.name: Eric Trump
persons.context: Donald Trump's son, listed as having traveled with him on Epstein's private jet.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Owner of the private jet, central figure in the case
persons.context: The flight records are for his private jet; he is listed as a passenger on flights with Donald Trump and others.

connections.description: Travel companions on Epstein's private jet, including a 1993 flight where they were the only two listed passengers.
Were both passengers on at least four flights on Epstein's private jet between 1993 and 1996.

events.title: Trump's flights on Epstein's jet
events.description: Donald Trump traveled on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet on at least eight flights between 1993 and 1996, including flights with Ghislaine Maxwell and his family.

events.title: Review of Epstein flight records
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York finished reviewing more than 100 pages of flight records for Epstein's private jet, revealing new information about Donald Trump's travels.

keyFacts: Flight records show Donald Trump traveled on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet on at least eight flights between 1993 and 1996, which is more than previously reported.
Trump and Ghislaine Maxwell were both passengers on at least four of these flights during the period relevant to a potential Maxwell case.
On one flight in 1993, Trump and Epstein were the only two listed passengers.
Trump traveled on the jet with his then-wife Marla Maples and his children Tiffany and Eric.
The flight records also identified two women who would be possible witnesses in a Ghislaine Maxwell case.
